values.content:
=Create a good meta description for the following blog post: 

{{ $('Creador de Links Internos').item.json.message.content }}

A good meta description for a blog post that is SEO-optimized should:
- Be Concise: Stick to 150-160 characters to ensure the full description displays in search results. 
- Include Keywords: Incorporate primary keywords naturally to improve visibility and relevance to search queries.

Primary keyword = {{ $('Analista inicial').item.json.message.content['Primary Keyword'] }}
More keywords to include if possible = [{{ $('Analista inicial').item.json.message.content.Keywords }}]

- Provide Value: Clearly describe what the reader will learn or gain by clicking the link. 

- Be Engaging: Use persuasive language, such as action verbs or a question, to encourage clicks. 

- Align with Content: Ensure the description accurately reflects the blog post to meet user expectations and reduce bounce rates. 

Your output must only be the meta description and nothing else.

parameters.content:
# üìΩÔ∏è Workflow: De YouTube a Blog en WordPress

**Autor:** Creador por [Juan Pe Navarro](https://www.instagram.com/juanpe.divisual/)

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 1 ‚Äì Encendido de la idea

### Activamos el flujo y tomamos el siguiente cl√∫ster de v√≠deos desde **Google Sheets**.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è Extraemos el **t√≠tulo**, las **palabras clave** y la **transcripci√≥n** del contenido.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 2 ‚Äì N√∫cleo estrat√©gico

### Con **GPT**, generamos una primera estructura del post. Luego usamos **Perplexity** para ampliar la investigaci√≥n y validamos manualmente los enlaces.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è Obtenemos un plan claro y bien fundamentado.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 3 ‚Äì Creaci√≥n del art√≠culo

### Convertimos el plan y la investigaci√≥n en un art√≠culo completo optimizado para **SEO**.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è El contenido es limpio, extenso y de alto valor.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 4 ‚Äì Optimizaci√≥n SEO

### Recuperamos posts anteriores desde **Google Sheets** y a√±adimos **enlaces internos** relevantes dentro del texto (como URLs en crudo).  
### ‚û°Ô∏è Esto potencia el posicionamiento mediante vinculaci√≥n interna inteligente.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 5 ‚Äì Generaci√≥n de metadatos

Creamos los metadatos esenciales del post:  
- Slug  
- T√≠tulo  
- Meta descripci√≥n  
‚û°Ô∏è Todo basado en la versi√≥n final del art√≠culo.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 6 ‚Äì Envoltorio visual

### Seleccionamos una imagen de portada adecuada mediante API y dejamos lista toda la parte visual.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è Imagen optimizada para el blog y redes.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 7 ‚Äì Publicaci√≥n y registro

### Convertimos el art√≠culo a formato **HTML** y registramos todo en **Google Sheets**.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è Garantizamos trazabilidad y control de calidad.

---

# ‚úÖ Paso 8 ‚Äì Publicaci√≥n final

### Publicamos el post directamente en **WordPress** con sus metadatos e imagen.  
### ‚û°Ô∏è El blog ya est√° online y perfectamente rastreado.

---




üîß Hecho con ‚ù§Ô∏è  por el equipo de [Divisual](https://www.instagram.com/juanpe.divisual/)

values.content:
=You are part of a team that creates world-class blog posts.

You are the team‚Äôs most skilled copywriter. Your role is to **continue and complete a long-form blog article**, following the detailed structure and tone of the first part.

You are given:
- The **first half of the blog post** (already written).
- The **detailed blog plan**, outlining all remaining sections.
- A list of **research insights** to integrate where relevant.

---

üéØ Your task:

Continue and **finish writing the blog post** in the same style and structure en idioma espa√±ol.

---

### Guidelines

#### ‚úÖ Structure & Formatting
- Continue where Part 1 ended. DO NOT rewrite the introduction or previous sections.
- Follow the blog plan step by step.
- Use proper H2/H3 headings.
- Write **short paragraphs** (max 4 lines).
- Use bullet points where needed.
- Include LSI keywords or synonyms naturally.

#### ‚úçÔ∏è Style & Tone
- Write in a clear, simple tone (Year 5 level).
- Add concrete value in every paragraph.
- Be friendly, professional, and action-oriented.

#### üîç SEO Requirements
- Use all specified keywords (from the plan) in appropriate sections.
- Include the **main keyword** at least once more near the end.
- Do not keyword stuff, but weave terms naturally into the copy.

#### üìå Research Usage
- Cite any research insight with the format:  
  *(Source: [insert URL])*
- Include all relevant research listed in the plan.

#### üõë Do Not:
- Repeat or rewrite anything from Part 1.
- Summarize what was said before.
- Say ‚Äúas we saw earlier‚Äù ‚Äî just continue smoothly.

---

Now, here is what you have:

**First Half of the Blog Post**:  
{{ $("Write Full Article 1").item.json.message.content }}

**Remaining Plan (continued)**:  
{{ $("Borrador inicial").item.json.message.content }}

**Research Summaries**:  
{{ $("Manual Link Fixer").item.json.research }}

Now write the **second half of the article**. Finish all sections cleanly. Include a final **Conclusion** and a detailed **FAQ** section.
The total length of this Part 2 should be around **1100+ words**.

=You are part of a team that creates world-class blog posts.
You are the team‚Äôs top copywriter, tasked with writing the first half of a complete blog article.

For each assignment, you are given:

A detailed plan that breaks down the structure section by section, including headings, keywords, notes, and examples.

A list of research summaries to integrate where appropriate.

üéØ Your mission: Write the Part 1 of the blog post (from the introduction up to the middle of the article) based on the structure.

‚úçÔ∏è Guidelines:
Structure
Write a strong H1 title using the primary keyword.

Follow the blog plan section by section, respecting the order.

Cover only the first half of the plan (introduction, common problems, core philosophy, and early steps).

Stop naturally at the mid-point, and leave the rest for Part 2.

Formatting
Use H2 and H3 headings from the plan with the exact keywords.

Use short paragraphs (max 4 lines).

Use bullet points where possible.

Insert internal transitions that invite the reader to keep scrolling.

Style
Simple and clear writing (Year 5 reading level).

Value-dense: No fluff, no generic intros.

Add examples, analogies, metaphors, and concrete advice.

Word Count
Aim for ~1,100 words in this part.

SEO & Research
Include all relevant keywords in the appropriate headings and sections.

Integrate at least 4 research references, using this format:
(Source: [insert URL])

Output Rules:
Return only the Part 1 blog content (from H1 to the natural halfway point).

Do not include a conclusion or FAQ in this part.

Do not summarize anything or describe what you‚Äôre doing.

El resultado debe ser en espa√±ol perfecto.

Now generate the first half of the blog post using:

Blog Plan:
{{ $('Borrador inicial').item.json.message.content }}

Research Summaries:
{{ $('Manual Link Fixer').item.json.research }}

=Eres parte de un equipo que crea art√≠culos de blog de nivel mundial.

Para cada nuevo proyecto de art√≠culo, se te proporciona:
- Una **transcripci√≥n de un video de YouTube** que resume las ideas centrales de una presentaci√≥n hablada o un video.
- Una lista de **palabras clave** que el art√≠culo debe incluir para tener un buen rendimiento en los motores de b√∫squeda.
- Una **intenci√≥n de b√∫squeda** que describe lo que el usuario espera aprender o lograr con el art√≠culo.
- Una **palabra clave principal**, que debe aparecer en el t√≠tulo y en el primer p√°rrafo del art√≠culo.

Tu tarea es analizar la transcripci√≥n, comprender la estructura l√≥gica de las ideas y mensajes, y proponer un **plan preliminar para el art√≠culo**. Este plan ser√° utilizado por un estratega de contenidos para redactar el art√≠culo completo.

Tu respuesta debe:
- Identificar los **temas centrales** y los **puntos clave de discusi√≥n** a partir de la transcripci√≥n.
- Respetar la **intenci√≥n** del contenido (informativo, inspirador, pr√°ctico...).
- Asegurarte de que **todas las palabras clave est√©n integradas de forma natural** en el contenido.
- Estar estructurada en **formato de vi√±etas**, con secciones claras y flujo l√≥gico.

Importante:
- No est√°s escribiendo el art√≠culo, solo un esquema en formato de puntos.
- El plan debe girar en torno a la **palabra clave principal**.
- Aseg√∫rate de que la **intenci√≥n de b√∫squeda del usuario est√© completamente satisfecha** con el plan.
- Usa la transcripci√≥n para **extraer contenido significativo**, no solo para rellenar con texto SEO.
- Ten en cuenta el blog anterior para no sonar repetitivo y/o hacer referencias.

---

**Transcripci√≥n:**  
{{ $('Traductor').item.json.message.content }}

**Palabras clave:**  
{{ $json.message.content.Keywords }}

**Intenci√≥n de b√∫squeda:**  
{{ $json.message.content['Search Intent'] }}

**Palabra clave principal:**  
{{ $json.message.content['Primary Keyword'] }}

**Blog Anterior**


---

Crea el plan preliminar del art√≠culo.

values.content: =Eres un traductor experto con enfoque en SEO y conocimiento profundo de expresiones idiom√°ticas tanto en ingl√©s como en espa√±ol. Recibir√°s una transcripci√≥n de un v√≠deo de YouTube en ingl√©s. Tu tarea es traducirla al espa√±ol natural y perfecto, adaptando expresiones, tonos y frases coloquiales al lenguaje cotidiano y fluido del espa√±ol.

=Eres un analista SEO experto en generaci√≥n de contenido estrat√©gico.

Tu tarea es leer la siguiente transcripci√≥n de un video de YouTube y extraer:
1. Una **palabra clave principal**: la m√°s relevante y representativa del tema tratado. Debe ser clara, espec√≠fica, con potencial de b√∫squeda y capaz de aparecer en el t√≠tulo de un art√≠culo.
2. De 5 a 10 **palabras clave secundarias o relacionadas**: t√©rminos relevantes que pueden ayudar a posicionar el contenido en motores de b√∫squeda. Incluye sin√≥nimos, t√©rminos long-tail y conceptos relacionados.
3. La **intenci√≥n de b√∫squeda** del usuario: define si el contenido es informativo, educativo, comercial, transaccional, etc., y qu√© objetivo tiene el usuario al consumir este contenido.

No generes texto de m√°s. Devuelve los datos en formato limpio y claro:

---

**Primary Keyword:**  
[palabra clave principal]

**Keywords:**  
- [keyword 1]  
- [keyword 2]  
- [keyword 3]  
...

**Search Intent:**  
[intenci√≥n de b√∫squeda resumida en una frase]

---

values.content:
=You are part of a team that creates world-class blog posts. Your job is to handle **internal linking** between blog posts to enhance SEO and reader navigation. For each new blog post, you are given: - The **full HTML content of the current blog**, split into two parts: `html_part_1` and `html_part_2`. - A list of **previous blog posts** with their titles, summaries, keywords, and URLs. --- ### üß† Your mission: Identify and insert **at least 5 internal links** pointing to previous blog posts, only if they are **highly relevant**. --- ### ‚úÖ Linking Criteria: - Use the **title**, **meta description**, and **keywords** of previous blog posts to find relevant sections in the current HTML. - Only insert links if the previous post‚Äôs topic is **closely related** and **adds value** for the reader. - Avoid keyword stuffing or irrelevant insertions. **Quality and contextual value > quantity**. --- ### üîß How to add links: - Insert the **raw URL** (e.g., `https://mydomain.com/blog-post-url`) **directly into the HTML**, at the **most relevant position** within `

` or `

  • ` tags. - Do **not use anchor tags**, Markdown, or HTML attributes. - Do **not modify** the structure or content of the blog post. - Do **not reformat or rewrite** any existing part of the HTML, headings, or layout. - You may insert the same link more than once **only if** it‚Äôs naturally relevant in multiple sections. --- ### üßæ Output format: Return the **modified blog post** as a JSON object with these two fields: - `html_part_1`: the updated first part of the HTML - `html_part_2`: the updated second part of the HTML Do **not return** the previous blog post list. Do **not explain your work** or include any commentary. --- Now process this: **HTML** {{ $('Generador de HTML').item.json.message.content }} **Previous Blog Posts**: {{ $('Aggregate Keywords').item.json['previous-posts'][0].HTML }}

=Extract the blog post title from the following blog post: 
{{ $('Creador de Links Internos').item.json.message.content }}



The blog post title must include the primary keyword {{ $('Analista inicial').item.json.message.content['Primary Keyword'] }} and must inform the users right away of what they can expect from reading the blog post. 

- Don't put the output in "". The output should just text with no markdown or formatting. 

Your output must only be the blog post title and nothing else.

values.content:
=DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING OTHER THAN THE CODE. I want you to follow the layout of the template as a guide to generate the WordPress code for a blog post. Here are the rules to follow: The blog post should have a title, estimated reading time, key takeaways, table of contents, body, and FAQ in this order. Make it engaging by using italics, dot points, quotes, bold, spaces, and sometimes new lines. Never use emojis. The blog post will have some URLs referenced next to certain keyphrases to show where the info came from. You must hyperlink the keyphrase with the provided URL so that the reader can click on the referenced URL. It is critical you get this right. Wrap the entire content in a container
with inline CSS that sets the text color to white (#ffffff), uses a legible font such as Arial, sans-serif, and sets line-height to 1.6. Ensure that all non-heading text elements (e.g., paragraphs, list items) have an inline style or embedded style that sets their font size to 20px and color to white (#ffffff) using !important to override theme styles. Hyperlinks, points in the table of contents, and FAQ questions must be styled in yellow (#fac51c). All headings and subheadings should have an underline implemented via a bottom border in yellow (#fac51c) with appropriate padding. Place a double break (

) between each section to improve readability. Do not output any extra text or mention code tags like HTML''' around the output; just output the HTML code. --- ## Blog post: Here is the full content of the blog post, split into two parts. You must merge and format both parts seamlessly to create the final HTML output. **Part 1:** {{ $('Write Full Article 1').item.json.message.content }} **Part 2:** {{ $('Write Full Article 2').item.json.message.content }}
